results.title: Matchmaker at work
results.brief_description: Outlines recent developments in the CRA group, including: - establishment of Hamersley’s second mine complex at Paraburdoo; the Bougainville Copper operation; Comalco’s integrated aluminium group, and integration of lead zinc interests into Australian Mining and Smelting.

results.title: Matcham Skipper: metal sculptor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Craftman and His Environment”.
A study of Matcham Skipper, one of Australia’s best known workers in silver, making jewellery and sculpting in silver at his studio in the old artists’ colony of Montsalvat, Victoria, in 1973. The film features the process of lost-wax casting. The film was funded by the Crafts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: Match de Prestidigitation
results.brief_description: A magician divides himself into two people, who then perform tricks before transforming back into one person, in one of Georges Méliès’ early trick films that pioneered special effects.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Matalau: a Tolai Village in New Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
The last film in the series looks at a highly developed indigenous community - Matalau. Considers the impact Europeans have had on the traditional Tolai culture. Looks at the economy which is based on cash croppage - copra, cocoa, fishing and wage earning; and discusses future development.

results.title: Matador [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Andres Gomes, Television Espanola and Cia Iberoamericana de Tv Sa
results.brief_description: In “Madador”, Pedro Almodovar’s fifth feature, the director combines sex and death in quintessential Almodovar style. After his earlier, more outrageous comedies (“What have I done to deserve this”, “Dark habits”, “Labyrinth of passion”), Almodovar moved into more sombre terrain with this mediation on eroticism, death and bullfighting. Of course this doesn’t mean that “Matador” doesn’t have it’s own share of outrageous moments, as it mixes notions of machismo and sadomasochism to lurid effect. The film’s perverse story revolves around two fatalistic star cross lovers, one an ex-bullfighter (Nacho Martinez), the other a serial killing lawyer (Assumpta Serena), both bound together by their taste for blood and an erotic predilection for murder. The film draws in many varied influences, most notably the 1946 Hollywood melodrama, “Duel in the sun”, another sumptuous paean to sexual perversity and death. Cast includes Antonio Banderas, Carmen Maura and Eva Como. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Masuo Ikeda: printmaker
results.brief_description: A modern Japanese artist living in New York creates a colour print from a copper plate as he explains his sources of inspiration and techniques. His work is shown form making the plates through to pulling the final prints.

results.title: Mastri: a Balinese woman
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours. Indonesia”.
Mastri and Sukit are a young couple from the village on Tunjuk in South Bali. Sukit is a school teacher. They live in the house of Sukit’s parents and are saving their money to build a house of their own. Tunjuk has its own small dance company and Gong orchestra which is sometimes invited to perform at the tourist hotels around Denpasar, and Mastri is one of the principal dancers. The film contrasts normal village life with the “tourist’s” Bali and shows something of the religious life of the people of Tunjuk. Camerman Don McAlpine.

results.title: Mastitus: disease of the udder
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Cherry, Evelyn Cherry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An account of the causes, symptoms, prevention and cure of three types of mastitis in cattle: Acute, chronic and summer. The film illustrates common practices that contribute to the spread of the disease and demonstrates practical tests and treatment. The advantages of veterinary and clinical analysis and treatment are stressed.
